posts.post_content:
"These kids today with their collector numbers and their newfangled tap symbol. Twenty [Black Lotus](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Black Lotus)es and twenty [Plague Rat](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Plague Rat)s. Now that's real **Magic**." - [Old Fogey](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Old Fogey).  
  
But yeah there isn't much of a reason to use Plague Rats when you could be using [Relentless Rats](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Relentless Rats) instead.
posts.html:
"These kids today with their collector numbers and their newfangled tap symbol. Twenty Black Lotuses and twenty Plague Rats. Now that's real Magic." - Old Fogey.

But yeah there isn't much of a reason to use Plague Rats when you could be using Relentless Rats instead.

Posted By: Paleopaladin (7/15/2010 11:09:25 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
As fjdkslan has said, you used to be able to construct a deck of 20 plague rats (and for that matter, 20 [Dark Ritual](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Dark Ritual)s). Both of those cards are a BIG reason you're only allowed 4 of any card today, since neither card was not powerful enough to ban/restrict.  
  
Originally, high cost/slowness was the only thing that made them balanced. When the new rules nerfed them, [Pestilence Rats](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Pestilence Rats) were added as a way to recapture some of their swarming ability in a card that was useful even with only one on the field. [Relentless Rats](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Relentless Rats) is a similar attempt to bring back swarming with creatures that are useful even with only one on the field.
posts.html:
As fjdkslan has said, you used to be able to construct a deck of 20 plague rats (and for that matter, 20 Dark Rituals). Both of those cards are a BIG reason you're only allowed 4 of any card today, since neither card was not powerful enough to ban/restrict.

Originally, high cost/slowness was the only thing that made them balanced. When the new rules nerfed them, Pestilence Rats were added as a way to recapture some of their swarming ability in a card that was useful even with only one on the field. Relentless Rats is a similar attempt to bring back swarming with creatures that are useful even with only one on the field.

posts.post_content:
Bah! I refuse to let some "four-copy maximum" rule stop me from legally playing (and killing you with) more than four!  
  
1) [Plague Rats](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Plague Rats) and as many creatures as possible ([Sengir Autocrat](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sengir Autocrat), [Hunted Horror](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Hunted Horror) and [Hunted Phantasm](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Hunted Phantasm) are good)  
2) [Levitation](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Levitation)  
3) [Mirrorweave](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mirrorweave)  
  
Take *that*! I don't need no stinkin' [Pestilence Rats](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Pestilence Rats) or [Relentless Rats](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Relentless Rats)!  
  
...  
  
Also, [Tombstone Stairwell](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Tombstone Stairwell) would be an interesting, if difficult to manage, addition.
